trans-unit.source: Specifies whether <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManager"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReference"></xref> objects refer to the debug or release version of client scripts.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptMode> enumeration provides values for setting the version of client script to use on a Web page.

The enumeration values can be applied to either the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager.ScriptMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property or to the [ScriptReference.ScriptMode](<xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReferenceBase.ScriptMode%2A>) property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> object sets the version for all scripts on the page unless it is overridden by a <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReference> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReference> object sets the version for a particular script.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Auto?displayProperty=fullName> value produces different results depending on whether it refers to a standalone script file or to a script file that is embedded as a resource in an assembly.
A standalone script file is defined with the [ScriptReference.Path](<xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReferenceBase.Path%2A>) property.
An assembly reference must be accessed through the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReference.Name%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReference.Assembly%2A> properties.
The results for the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Auto?displayProperty=fullName> value are as follows:

When it is applied to a standalone script file where the [ScriptReference.Path]<xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReferenceBase.Path%2A> property is specified, the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Auto?displayProperty=fullName> value is equivalent to <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Release?displayProperty=fullName>.

When it is applied to a script reference in an assembly, <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Auto?displayProperty=fullName> is equivalent to <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Inherit?displayProperty=fullName>.
When only <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReference.Name%2A> is specified, it is used to reference the script.

When <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReference.Name%2A> and the [ScriptReference.Path]<xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReferenceBase.Path%2A> property are both specified, the [ScriptReference.Path]<xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReferenceBase.Path%2A> property is used instead of <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReference.Name%2A>, but the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Auto?displayProperty=fullName> value is still equivalent to <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Inherit?displayProperty=fullName>.
An error is thrown if the requested version of the script does not exist.

For instance, an error is thrown if a reference is made to a standalone script file that is named CustomScript.js and the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager.ScriptMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Debug?displayProperty=fullName>, but CustomScript.debug.js does not exist on the site.
References to scripts in an assembly return the release version if the debug version does not exist.

When the `retail` attribute of the [deployment](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/dbcc2c62-3159-4a62-9f1e-8cfe3b8b09dc) element of the Machine.config file is set to `true`, the release versions of client scripts are used throughout the Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptMode> values in the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager.ScriptMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and [ScriptReference.ScriptMode](<xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptReferenceBase.ScriptMode%2A>) properties are ignored.

In the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManager"></xref> control, the version of client scripts to use is determined at run time based on the application-level [<compilation>](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/7c319582-074a-4d2a-a787-03b9d4541c12) element of the Web.config file, unless it is overridden in an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReference"></xref> control.

In the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReference"></xref> control, when applied to a standalone script file, <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Auto"></xref> is equivalent to <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Release"></xref>.
When applied to a script reference in an assembly, <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Auto"></xref> is equivalent to <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Inherit"></xref>.

In the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManager"></xref> control, the debug version of the client script is used on the Web page unless overridden in an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReference"></xref> control.
In the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReference"></xref> control, the debug version of the client script is used on the Web page.
In the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManager"></xref> control, <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Inherit"></xref> is equivalent to <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Auto"></xref>.

In the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReference"></xref> control, the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManager.ScriptMode"></xref> value from <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManager"></xref> determines which version of the client script to use.

In the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptManager"></xref> control, the release version of the client script is used on the Web page unless overridden by setting the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReference.ScriptMode"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReference"></xref> instance to <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptMode.Debug"></xref>.
In the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ScriptReference"></xref> control, the release version of the client script is used on the Web page.
